intro: Dianthus benearnensis, commonly known as the Benearn's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit, making it distinctive in its native range. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
